definition: (coll.) old man/(said of an aging husband) my old man

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: That ( old ) gaffer going into the pub is 90 years old.
sentences.chinese: 走进酒店的那个老头子已经90岁了。
你这个满脸鼻涕的老头子。

sentences.english: And you , fucking tell him now . what geezer.
sentences.chinese: 就一个老头子而言，你的身板儿还挺不错的。

sentences.english: The old man kissed his knees and called him the good God.
sentences.chinese: 那个老头子吻着他的膝头，称他为慈悲的上帝。

sentences.english: Jack pours the spirit into Molly's father's cup personally.
sentences.chinese: 杰克亲自给老头子斟上酒。

sentences.english: "Do you have scruples about that old headman in the temple?"The sea pumice disagrees a way.
sentences.chinese: “你顾忌宫里那个老头子？”海浮石不以为然道。

sentences.english: I hope you like old fogy food.
sentences.chinese: 希望你们会喜欢老头子吃的菜。

sentences.english: I remember of that disgusting old man.
sentences.chinese: 我想起那个糟老头子来了。

sentences.english: She wants to marry an old rich man.
sentences.chinese: 她想嫁一个有钱的老头子。

sentences.english: And the old man turned angrily away, when he caught sight of the face.
sentences.chinese: 老头子看见了这副面孔，气忿地转过身去。

sentences.english: I hear Xiao Li is head over heels in love with an old man who is 30 years older than her.
sentences.chinese: 听说小丽爱上一个比她大三十岁的老头子。

sentences.english: You're in pretty good shape for a geezer .
sentences.chinese: 就一个老头子而言，你的身板儿还挺不错的。

sentences.english: "I know enough, " insisted old Archibald, determinedly.
Then Mrs. Claus told Santa that her mother was coming to visit.
sentences.chinese: 就在这时，圣诞夫人告诉老头子，丈母娘要来。

sentences.english: Do you want to hear something interesting? She wants to marry an old rich man.
sentences.chinese: 你想听一些有趣的事吗？她想嫁一个有钱的老头子。

definition: see 老頭子|老头子[lao3 tou2 zi5]
variant of 老家伙[lao3 jia1 huo5]
(derog.) old but still alive/old fart/old bastard
(literary) youngster/(old) young fellow (term of address used by the older generation)/(old) I, me (used in speaking to one's elders)
polite term for old woman or man
my (you etc) old father/polite appellation for an elderly male
elder brother (often used self-referentially)/(form of address between male friends) old chap/buddy
